markdownRemark.html:
FHIR Resources Schema

  • Server supports only version R4.0.1 of the FHIR specification
  • The _format parameter is supported and defaults to application/fhir+json in the absence of the parameter or ACCEPT header
  • Server’s Capabilities Statement is available via the [base]/metadata endpoint

Supported FHIR Profiles

The following profiles have been enabled in the FHIR Server. Any new resources created/updated will be validated against these profiles.

  • US Core Implementation Guide (v3.1.1: STU3 Update) http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/
  • CARIN Consumer Directed Payer Data Exchange (CARIN IG for BlueButton®) Implementation Guide (v1.0.0 - STU1) http://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1
  • Da Vinci Health Record Exchange (HREX) Implementation Guide (0.2.0 - STU R1 - 2nd ballot) http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-hrex/2020Sep/artifacts.html
  • Da Vinci Payer Data Exchange (PDEX) Implementation Guide (v1.0.0 - STU1) http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex/STU1
  • Da Vinci Payer Data Exchange (PDEX) Plan Net Implementation Guide (v1.0.0 - STU1) http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex-plan-net/STU1
  • Da Vinci Payer Data Exchange (PDeX) US Drug Formulary (v1.0.1 - STU1.0.1) http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-drug-formulary/STU1.0.1
  • HL7 FHIR Implementation Guide: minimal Common Oncology Data Elements (mCODE) Release 1 - US Realm | STU1 (v1.0.0 - STU1) http://hl7.org/fhir/us/mcode/STU1
